introduction: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:
text:
• A group of mathematicians known as Nicolas Bourbaki was formed in 1935.
• They were actually pseudonymous; “Bourbaki” was not a single individual but a collective of young French mathematicians.
• Their goal was to reformulate mathematics on an extremely rigorous, foundational basis.
• They published a long series of influential textbooks covering topics from set theory to advanced calculus.
• Their works influenced the structure of math curricula worldwide.
question: The student wants to stress the unusual nature of Nicolas Bourbaki’s authorship. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?
A: Bourbaki’s textbooks, spanning from set theory to advanced calculus, influenced math curricula worldwide.
B: Formed in 1935, the collective known as Nicolas Bourbaki published many foundational works on mathematics.
C: The name Nicolas Bourbaki was used by a group of young French mathematicians who wrote rigorous texts under a single pseudonym.
D: Mathematicians from France shaped the field with new definitions and approaches to foundational math.
explanation: Choice C highlights the pseudonymous and collective nature of Bourbaki, fulfilling the goal of emphasizing the group’s unusual authorship.
